[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: BlockSynchronizationKillSwitch] [Timing Attack] Can strategic timing of interrupt_requested() calls be exploited to halt execution only for specific transactions (e.g., slashing transactions), allowing malicious validators to avoid penalties? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_state_value()] [Cache Poisoning] Can an attacker provide a malicious StateKey that returns crafted StateValue data to poison the resource cache and cause incorrect transaction execution across the network? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_state_value()] [Type Confusion] Does the function properly validate that the returned StateValue matches the expected resource type, or can type confusion allow reading arbitrary memory as typed resources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_state_value()] [Error Handling] When get_resource_state_value() returns Err, does the error properly prevent transaction execution, or can error handling bugs allow proceeding with invalid/missing resource data? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_bytes()] [Memory Exhaustion] Can an attacker query resources with extremely large StateValue bytes to cause memory exhaustion during bytes().clone(), leading to validator crashes and liveness loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_bytes()] [Race Condition] If get_resource_bytes() is called concurrently for the same resource during parallel execution, can cloning bytes lead to inconsistent reads and validation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_state_value_metadata()] [Metadata Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate StateValueMetadata (slot, deposit) to bypass gas fees or storage costs, allowing unlimited free storage and economic attack? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_state_value_size()] [Integer Overflow] Can an attacker create resources with sizes exceeding u64::MAX to cause integer overflow in size calculations, leading to incorrect gas charging and free storage? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_state_value_size()] [Gas Metering Bypass] Can the size calculation return 0 for existing resources to bypass write gas fees, allowing attackers to write unlimited data without paying gas costs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resource_exists()] [TOCTOU Race] In parallel execution, can a Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use race between resource_exists() check and actual resource access allow double-spending or unauthorized resource modification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resource_group_size()] [Validation Failure] Can an attacker craft resource groups where size != 0 but exists = false (or vice versa) to intentionally trigger validation failures and halt block execution? (High)
